hypothesis_content.title: CPI Surprise Amplification with ETF Flow Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When a CPI surprise (actual vs. consensus > 0.2%) occurs during NEUTRAL regime, the initial 30-minute price move will be amplified by 1.5-2.5x over the next 4 hours if accompanied by confirming spot ETF flows (>$50M net inflow/outflow in the same direction).
hypothesis_content.rationale: CPI surprises create initial volatility, but sustained moves require capital flow confirmation. ETF flows provide institutional validation that amplifies retail sentiment. Recent CPI surprise (2.7% vs expectations) showed this pattern but lacked immediate ETF confirmation for full amplification.
entry_conditions: CPI release with surprise magnitude > 0.2% (actual vs. consensus)
BTC price moves > 1.5% in first 30 minutes post-release
Spot BTC ETF net flows in same direction exceed $50M within first 60 minutes

exit_conditions.take_profit: 4-hour close with position P&L = 2.0x the initial 30-minute move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses beyond 0.8x the initial 30-minute move

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of qualifying events show amplification factor < 1.2x or price reversal within 2 hours despite confirming flows.
